note.label: This section lists all the available attributes for the Google Shopping feed. Some attributes are required for all products and some are required for certain product types such as apparel. To avoid errors in your Google Merchant account please make sure that you provide all the required attributes.

id.label: ID Attribute
id.comment:
Select the attribute for the product ID. Use a unique value for each product.
Suggested field: SKU.

name.label: Name Attribute
name.tooltip: You can use the -custom attribute option from the dropdown to create a custom name using active attributes.
name.comment:
Select the attribute for the product name. This need to match the title of your landing page.
Suggested field: Product Name.

name_custom.label: Name - Custom
name_custom.tooltip:
Use Custom Attributes

Use attribute codes or static text to create a custom value. Example; Demostore {{name}} {{color}}

name_conditional.label: Name - Conditional
name_conditional.tooltip:
Use Conditional Attributes

Use conditional attributes to generate a value with a if then construction.
You can generate a if then else construction using the question mark ? and the colon :

For example if you use the following value;

If short description exists, then show short description or else description:
{{short_description}} ? {{short_description}} : {{description}}


Another example;

If description exists, then show description, else show name + sku + shortdescription
{{description}} ? {{description}} : {{name}} {{sku}} {{short_description}}

description.label: Description Attribute
description.comment:
Select the attribute for the description. As required by Google the description will be truncated to a maximum of 5000 characters and stripped of html.
Suggested field: Description.

description_custom.label: Description - Custom
description_custom.tooltip:
Use Custom Attributes

Use attribute codes or static text to create a custom value. Example; Demostore {{name}} {{color}}

description_conditional.label: Description - Conditional
description_conditional.tooltip:
Use Conditional Attributes

Use conditional attributes to generate a value with a if then construction.
You can generate a if then else construction using the question mark ? and the colon :

For example if you use the following value;

If short description exists, then show short description or else description:
{{short_description}} ? {{short_description}} : {{description}}


Another example;

If description exists, then show description, else show name + sku + shortdescription
{{description}} ? {{description}} : {{name}} {{sku}} {{short_description}}

images.label: Images
images.comment: Select the right image source. Accurately display the product you're selling. It's recommended to select all the images as source to export the additional images.

image1.label: Default first image
image1.comment: Select the source for the main image, other images will be exported as additional image(s).

condition_note.label: The condition is an required field for the feed. Only three options are available: New, Refurbished & Used. Please select the default condition of your products, when you change the condition on product-level in the Google Shopping Tab the product-condition will be overwritten.

gtin_note.label:
Required for all products with a GTIN assigned by the manufacturer. A GTIN is the numerical version of the bar code and identifies your product and needs to be unique for each product ID. Submit a GTIN as defined in the official GS1 validation guide.
More Information.

gtin_custom.label: GTIN - Custom
gtin_custom.tooltip:
Use Custom Attributes

Use attribute codes or static text to create a custom value. Example; Demostore {{name}} {{color}}

gtin_conditional.label: GTIN - Conditional
gtin_conditional.tooltip:
Use Conditional Attributes

Use conditional attributes to generate a value with a if then construction.
You can generate a if then else construction using the question mark ? and the colon :

For example if you use the following value;

If short description exists, then show short description or else description:
{{short_description}} ? {{short_description}} : {{description}}


Another example;

If description exists, then show description, else show name + sku + shortdescription
{{description}} ? {{description}} : {{name}} {{sku}} {{short_description}}

brand_note.label: Required for each product with a clearly associated brand or manufacturer.

brand_custom.label: Brand - Custom
brand_custom.tooltip:
Use Custom Attributes

Use attribute codes or static text to create a custom value. Example; Demostore {{name}} {{color}}

brand_conditional.label: Brand - Conditional
brand_conditional.tooltip:

Another example;

{{description}} ? {{description}} : {{name}} {{sku}} {{short_description}}

mpn_note.label:
Required MPN is a unique identifier issued by the manufacturer. If you have the GTIN in your feed the MPN is not mandatory.
Without a GTIN Google requires the MPN and Brand attribute.

mpn_custom.label: MPN - Custom
mpn_custom.tooltip:
Use Custom Attributes

Use attribute codes or static text to create a custom value. Example; Demostore {{name}} {{color}}

mpn_conditional.label: MPN - Conditional
mpn_conditional.tooltip:
Use Conditional Attributes

Use conditional attributes to generate a value with a if then construction.
You can generate a if then else construction using the question mark ? and the colon :

For example if you use the following value;

If short description exists, then show short description or else description:
{{short_description}} ? {{short_description}} : {{description}}


Another example;

If description exists, then show description, else show name + sku + shortdescription
{{description}} ? {{description}} : {{name}} {{sku}} {{short_description}}

category_note.label: Products are categorized in Google Shopping according to the Google product taxonomy. Use the most specific product category to meet the Google requirements. Click here to read more about the Google product Taxonomy. For more information how to configure the category see our Knowledge Base.

category_fixed.label: Default Category
category_fixed.comment:
Overwrite this value to specify the category.
To specify on Category Level
Navigate to: Catalog » Manage Categories » Select Category » Feeds » Google Product Category
To specify on Product Level
Navigate to: Catalog » Manage Products » Select Product » Google Shopping Tab » Google Shopping Product Category.

extra_note.label: Although not required, it is recommended that you provide the following product information if the attribute exists, or there are relevant values which match these product attributes:

color_custom.label: Color - Custom
color_custom.tooltip:
Use Custom Attributes

Use attribute codes or static text to create a custom value. Example; Demostore {{name}} {{color}}

{{description}} ? {{description}} : {{name}} {{sku}} {{short_description}}

tax_note.label:
By default prices are shown incl. Tax so only change this option if necessary.
If the feed export is without tax it's possible to add it with this option.

tax_percentage.label: Percentage
tax_percentage.comment: When the tax percentage is 21% use 21.

identifier_note.label: The Identifier Exists value informs Google if the products have valid product identifiers as a GTIN or MPN, this could be custom goods as hand made products. With the Identifier Exists attribute on False it tells Google that there aren't any product identifier available for the product. The True value isn't shown in the feed as this is default. We recommend using correct product identifiers if possible. More information

identifier.label: Use Identifier
identifier.comment:
Activate
Identifier exists = FALSE
Now you inform Google that you don't have product identifiers on the products.
Activate when less than two
Identifier exists = FALSE
Now you inform Google that you don't have product identifiers on the products but only on products with less then 2 product identifiers in your feed.
Deactivate
Identifier exists = TRUE
Now you inform Google that you do have product identifiers on the products.

producttype_note.label: The ‘product type’ attribute can indicates the category of the product being sold. Other then the Google Category Taxonomy gives the Product Types uses your Magento Category structure.

extra_note.label: You can add custom fields to your feed when needed. Please make sure that your using the latest custom fields standards to prevent error messages in the feed. The guidelines for the custom fields can be found right in our knowledgebase.

shipping_note.label: Add the Shipping rates directly into the feed to meet the Google Merchant requirements. You can set the price range of the products with a From and To price with the right shipping price for that specific product price range as the last column.

weight_note.label: This is the weight of the product used to calculate the shipping cost of the item. If you have specified a global shipping method that is dependent on shipping weight (Merchant Dashboard), this attribute will be used to calculate the shipping cost of the item automatically.
weight_note.comment: This calculation table is based on the product price, if you want to create more advanced rules as calculations based on country, category or weight you can configure this directly into your Google Merchant account.

configurable_note.label:
For configurable products we recommend to only add the simple products inside the configurable as the configurable product by itself can't be bought.
Choose the attribute(s) that you want to use from the parent relation configurable product.

conf_fields.label: Use Parent Data for Simple
conf_fields.comment: Select the attributes that you want to use from the parent configurable product, it's not recommended to select the attributes that needs to be unique for the Simples as GTIN/Color.

simple_price.label: Use Simple Product Pricing
simple_price.comment:
Recommended: No
Only enable this option when you have enabled an extension that is using the simple prices in your store.

configurable_parents.label: Export Configurable Parent
configurable_parents.comment:
Recommended: No
We don't recommend to export the Configurable Parent product as the parent product can't be bought by itself.

conf_switch_urls.label: Configurable Switch Urls
conf_switch_urls.comment:
Recommended: Yes
In this way the URL will be automatically link to the correct simple product on the configurable product landing page.

note_url.label: When your using Google Analytics you can add your UTM tags right here, eg. utm_source=googleshopping&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=googleshopping

note.label: This option allows you to include/exclude products from the Google Shopping feed based on the include/exclude attribute on the product, visibility, category and/or stock information.

visibility_heading.label: Only add products with the following visibility

categories.label: Category
categories.comment:
Include or Exclude products based on the category.

Note for Include:
Simple products within a bundled, configurable or grouped product are treated as own entities, so these should also be present in the included categories.

Note for Exclude:
Exclude the products from these categories. Products that are available within different categories need to be excluded from all of the categories they are assigned to.

note.label: Each store view will have it's own Google Shopping feed, you can easily enable or disable the Google Shopping feed generation on store level or automatically generate the Google Shopping feed. In case your not using the cron job functionality it's possible to generate the Google Shopping feed manually.

enabled.label: Enabled
enabled.comment: Enable or disable the feed generation for this store view or change the filename.

log_generation.label: Log Feed Generation
log_generation.comment: Write and save a log file with a summary of each feed generation. The logfile will be written to: var/log/googleshopping.log

paging.label: Paging
paging.comment: Recommend for big catalogs, e.g. catalogs of 50.000 SKU, use 5.000 per page.

limit.label: Limit per Page
limit.comment: Use the paging function on big catalogs, for example, if your catalog contains 50.000 SKU, use 5.000 per page to split the feed run and lower the load, the products will be combined in one feed after the generation is complete.

debug_memory.label: Debug Memory Usage
debug_memory.comment: Write the memory usage to the var/log/googleshopping.log file

bypass_flat.label: Bypass Flat Product Tables
bypass_flat.comment: Bypass Flat catalog tables. Will result in higher resource usage as this will bypass the flat catalog and product index tables.

overwrite.label: Overwrite Server Settings
overwrite.tooltip: Only use this option if it's necessary to overwrite this setting because of your server memory limit or execution time.

memory_limit.label: Memory Limit
memory_limit.comment: This overwrites the maximum amount of memory in bytes that a script is allowed to allocate, eg: 1024M.

max_execution_time.label: Max Execution Time
max_execution_time.comment: This overwrites the maximum time in seconds a script is allowed to run before it is terminated by the parser, eg: 300 (for 5 minutes).

cron.label: Enabled
cron.comment: The cronjob is a periodic script which runs automatically at a certain interval to generate the Google Shopping feed. Please make sure that your default Magento Cronjob is working. If not, contact your hosting company for help.

time.label: Start Time
time.tooltip: When using multiple feeds, the cron will run several times during this hour. For example when set to 12:00 with 3 feeds it will run at 12:00, 12:20, 12:40

frequency_custom.label: Custom Cron Expression
frequency_custom.comment: Disclaimer: Please make sure you enter a valid cron expression otherwise the feed will not be generated automatically. One feed will be generated per run, so keep this in mind for setting the expression.

test_button.label: Perform a self test to check your setup on errors.

feeds_note.label:
All active feeds are shown in the overview below.
The .XML URL is the URL which can be provided into your Google Merchant Account. Regarding some cache settings in the browser it's also possible to download the Feed to make sure that you are viewing the latest version. There is a small note at the end of the XML file where you can find the time of generation and the number of products.

Note: Make sure that you save the configuration after the settings are changed and before you generate the feed.
